aspguidp.controller.input.element.impl

Class TaskEntityInputController

  • java.lang.Object
    • aspguidp.controller.input.element.InputElementController
      • aspguidp.controller.input.element.EntityInputController
        • aspguidp.controller.input.element.impl.TaskEntityInputController

  • public class TaskEntityInputController
extends EntityInputController
    Controller class for a entity input component.

    An entity input component is assigned to a specific input entity. For each input entity of the application, there exists a DataServicePool class, which holds service instances and other data related information for the input entity.

    An entity input component contains a stacked input field which is used to input a new entity, a button which is used to store the inputted entity to the entity input component, a list view which displays the stored entities of the entity input component and a list view count label which is used to display the count of entities which are stored to the entity input component.

    The stacked input field of an entity input component is initialized by setting up the validation (ValidationService) for the input field, setting up an autocomplete popup (AutocompletePopupController) for the input field and setting up a key handler for the input field.

    The button of an entity input component is initialized in such a way, that it is only clickable, when the content of the stacked input field is validated as valid. If the button is clicked, the input of the stacked input field is converted to an Entity and added to the EntityDataManager of the service pool instance of the entity which is assigned to the entity input component.

    The list view of an entity input component displays all entities, which are managed by the entity data manager of the service pool of the entity which is assigned to the entity input component. The list view uses RemovableListCell instance, to enable the deletion of entities from the entity data manager.

    The list view count label of an entity input component displays the count of entities which is managed by the entity data manager of the service pool of the entity which is assigned to the entity input component. Additionally, a validation error class is set to the list view count label, if the count of entities contradicts the min and max entity count of the entity input component.

    Finally, an entity input component has an execution status and a data status which are registered to the respective status managers of the application (DataStatusManager, ExecutionStatusManager).

      • TaskEntityInputController

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        protected void initialize()
        Initialization method which is called when the respective .fxml file is loaded.

        This method initializes all child components of the entity input component with the data service pool of the entity of the entity input component.

        In the first step, the stacked input field of the entity input component is initialized by initializing the focus propagation of the stacked field, initializing the validation of the stacked field, initializing a key press handler for the stacked field and setting up the autocomplete popup for the stacked field.

        In the second step, the input button is initialized, the list view which is used to display entities which were inputted by the user is set up and the list view count label is initialized.

        In the last step, the execution status and the data status of the entity input component is registered to the status managers of the application.
